title: Police: 16-year-old shot himself during fight in north Nashville
content:
NASHVILLE, TN (WSMV) -
A shooting investigation in north Nashville has taken a strange twist.
Police said a teenager shot himself while fighting with three friends on 16th Avenue North near Underwood Street at 9:30 p.m. Tuesday.
The 16-year-old told police that the group tried to rob him and was firing shots at him.
Police said they believe the victim shot himself and then fired at the alleged robbery suspects.
The teenager is believed to have two gunshot wounds. He was taken to Vanderbilt University Medical Center with non-life-threatening injuries.
A 28-year-old man showed up at Nashville General Hospital with a gunshot wound. Police are working to figure out if the two incidents are related.
Stay with Channel 4 and WSMV.com for updates on this story.
